Key Match Events: Kylian Mbapp√© scored his first European Championship goal and the first scored by a French player at Euro 2024 with a penalty in the 56th minute
Robert Lewandowski scored a penalty in the 79th minute to level the score for Poland
Dayot Upamecano brought down Karol Swiderksi, resulting in a penalty for Poland
Post-Match Reflections: Didier Deschamps said he's not frustrated with the result, but acknowledges that France had to win to top the group
Deschamps stated that France achieved their first objective, but didn't get the place they wanted
Deschamps expressed that they could have been more effective, even with Lukasz Skorupski's fine saves
Miscellaneous Highlights: France finished second in Group D behind Austria
France will face whoever comes second in Group E in the next round
This is the first time France have failed to finish top of their group at a major tournament in 12 years under manager Didier Deschamps
Others: France dominated possession but were denied by Poland's excellent goalkeeper Lukasz Skorupski
Poland's fans created a raucous atmosphere in Dortmund after Lewandowski's goal
France's Antoine Griezmann was left on the bench, and his role is still unclear
